headline: Easy Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream
description: This sweetened condensed milk ice cream recipe is an easy way to make egg-free ice cream with just 3 simple ingredients and no cooking required.
name: Easy Homemade Vanilla Ice Cream
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Combine half-and-half, condensed milk, and vanilla in a large bowl; mix well. Pour into an ice cream freezer container. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy. Plus great taste!
Pretty easy

This has delicious flavor- love condensed milk! Yep tire was a bit off though; In the second time making it, I’m using half whole milk and half heavy cream (it’s what I have). I also combined the milk, condensed milk and 2 eggs on the stove top, cooked while continuously stirring until 165 degrees. Cooling completely, adding the vanilla and will use my Cuisinart Ice Cream Maker later!
I made this yesterday and froze it overnight. Tried some today and it's very grainy. Not a good recipe for me.

We started to make the non ice cream maker one only to realize that we were suppose to whip the whipping cream before folding it into the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla mixture. So then we added it it our ice cream maker. What we ended up with was a delicious and creamy vanilla ice cream that pleased all 6 of us! My oldest said it had a “marshmallow vibe. We also made a mint chocolate cookie frozen custard(we dyed it purple instead of green, because why not) and made mixed cones. Super happy tummies in this house
I loved this recipe!!! I tweaked it a bit. I used only 1 Tbs of vanilla and I used 1 1/2 c heavy cream and 2 1/2 c half and half. It is AMAZING!!!
I love this creamy delicious ice cream . I added a pinch of cinnamon. Wow... Plan on making it again
It’s the best ice cream ever
Was easy and very good. I made it twice and the second time added bananas.

I doubled the recipe and made a few different kinds of icecream with the base recipe. Cookies and cream was a huge hit, I threw coffee grounds in another mix- that was pretty awesome. Melted peanut butter and mixed it into another little container, loved that one. Alternated chocolate and caramel (layers) in another container, another wise decision. You can get pretty creative.
Very easy and delicious. It stayed soft even after freezing.

I wanted ice cream. But didn’t want to cook. Found this recipe but no half and half and no can of condensed milk. But I did have in my refrigerator was whole milk and heavy whipping cream plus Caramelized condensed milk. Mixed 2cups milk and 2cups cream, caramel, vanilla plus pink salt. And YUMMY SALTED CARAMEL ICE CREAM. I used oven method to make condensed milk caramel.
My family loves it!!! They are it before I could get a picture!
Easy and delicious! I served it to guests and it was a hit.
This is good and is very simple to make. You can also make it with low fat half and half and low fat condensed milk and it is still very good.
I made it as directed. It was in the ice cream freezer for over 4 hours and NEVER froze. It tasted awful as well.
Made exactly as written and it tasted like an alcoholic beverage. 2 Tablespoons of vanilla is way too much!

After reading a couple of other reviews and knowing that we would want to freeze leftovers for a couple of days, I made the following changes: 3 cups of heavy whipping cream and 1 cup of half & half. I needed to ensure that this remained creamy without ice milk crystals and this did the trick! However, you could probably use 2 cups cream and 2 cups half & half with similar results. I did not add any additional sugar as some recipes recommended. It was quite sweet enough. We did not use add-ins as this was our 1st time making it and we’d like a good base. This will definitely work for us and we look forward to experimenting with fruits and flavors!
We made this ice cream while camping. It was great! My husband has only eaten vanilla ice cream his whole lig

I will definitely make it again. I used an ice cream maker to freeze it but it was still pretty soft do we put it in the freezer overnight and the next day it was perfect. I had to double the recipe because this only makes half a gallon and i have a big family.
excellent taste, easy to make...tastes great
So easy and just add anything else like pecans or fruit!!
Amazing. I do 3 cups half&half and 1cup milk tho. I even made a chocolate version by simply

This was honestly as close as you can get to "custard" ice cream, without the eggs and heating. The sweetened condensed milk gives it a thick & creamy texture, with no added sugar needed. This will be our new "go-to" recipe for homemade ice cream.

I have made this many times over the last few summers. I use 1/2 whipping cream and 1/2 whole milk or light cream instead, don't need all that fat. I use my ice cream maker and add chop up Oreo cookies, any variety of candy bar or even M&M's candies at the end, then place it all in a freezer container to firm it up overnight. The kids all love it naturally but we know it's made with real milk and no by-products whatsoever.
Easy and delicious! Best homemade ice cream, I've ever made!

Wow, what an easy home made ice cream base. 
I made it with the help of my 13 year old daughter. 
I added frozen strawberry s in liquid. We put the strawberry s in a processor to make the berries less chunky. To our amazement it was awesome. It's for our family 4th of July party we are having tomorrow. During the party I'm going to make the Coco and Cinnamon receipt I read in one of the reviews. This is very inexpensive receipt to make. 
Have Fun!

Finally, I have an ice cream machine. Had it a year already-- just too busy to use it. It's the 4th of July. What better time to try it?
So, this recipe seemed the easiest. That's true, but it ain't your Grandma's homemade ice cream. My results were good, it's very smooth and creamy, but first taste was disappointing. Tasted like sweetened condensed milk added to vanilla ice cream. We'll eat it, but no shortcut for me next time.

I made this new recipe and put it into my ice cream maker, usually my ice cream maker makes ice cream in 20 mins but almost an hour later it was still liquid so I put it into a container into the freezer and 4 hours later it isn't even close to freezing. I will go back to my old recipe.

It was okay, company liked it. It was a quick and easy recipe. I agree with other reviews, it was more like ice than a cream. Did the job for a quick batch when I didn't have time to make old fashion on the stove.
I made this tonight and added fresh strawberries to the mixture. My family LOVED it! Will definitely make this again!
I loved it! tasted just like i remembered as a child. This recipe really took me back. so delicious!!!
though the directions were not clear, but it went out quite well.

This ice cream is AMAZING!!!! I will defiantly make it again. My daughter did complain that it was too sweet so next time I will try adding more whipping cream to the mixture to help cut the sweetness (I used the refrigerator freezer method). I however loved the texture and the taste plus it was super easy to make!
no changes,and yes i will make again
will make again soon.is the easiest,and creamiest homeade ice cream i have ever had.
Added toffee bar pieces, sea salt Carmel pieces, and bits of brickle. DELICIOUS
Very tasty, diffently will make again. Next time I will let it setup some more in the freezer after taking it out of the ice cream maker... if I can wait!

Made this using a Breville ice cream maker. The outcome exceeded my expectations.. Very good, rich vanilla taste and super easy to make..I followed the recipe exactly...I am thinking I will try with heavy cream next time plus will add a little coco.. I have been looking for a no egg no cook recipe... This one gets the job done!
Good easy recipe for a quick dessert. I mixed in crushed Oreos for a cookies-n-cream effect.

Excellent base! I added chopped up heath bars to mine. It's very creamy. Since I'm not used to such a creamy ice cream I probably would have done it with part milk and part half and half. Turned out very good and big hit with the company. I also made peanut butter ice cream with peanut butter cups. Seconds and thirds were had of each!
Will make this again! I used 2 cups whole milk and 2 cups half and half since I don't care for the heavy cream taste. I used my Cuisinart ice cream maker.
A lot of Vanilla, but quite good. Very easy!!!

Wow, this was good. I tweeked it by using heavy whipping cream, but that was too rich. 

When we went to the store to buy the sweetened condensed milk, they had caramel flavored, so I bought a couple. 

I doubled the recipe, but still only had the whipping cream since that was all I bought, and wanted to "tone" it down, so I added whole milk (3 cups) so it was still a little richer than the half and half. WOW! Caramel flavored ice cream - it was really good! Now I'm going to try mocha flavored, and when I get more caramel flavored condensed milk, will try to make a caramel frappuchino flavored one.

I like that this recipe is so easy to make and my kids get to help without making a complete mess!

So easy! My 8 year old niece and I made this. She was so proud and it tasted great.

We followed the directions (did not whip the cream first as another reviewer suggested) and it came out exactly as I like vanilla ice cream.

This is really good ice cream considering it only takes three ingredients and it is so easy to make. I just mixed everything in the ice cream freezer so I didn't have any cleanup. I'm looking forward to making this again and adding extras!

Made this 4th of July in my small soft serve maker. I halved recipe & it made perfect amount. I opened canned peaches then partially froze them, added to mix & chilled. Poured in frozen drum of maker. Made good ice cream with nice texture. Will make again.
This is such a simple recipe and makes creamy, delicious ice cream. We make it often and serve with fresh berries.
So easy and so very yummy!
Tastes great but won't be making this again. It took 24 hours to freeze to a almost solid state and then melts in less than 5 minutes once out of the freezer.
Absolutely loved the recipe. I did change a little bit. Instead of 4 cups of half and half I did 2 cups half and half and 2 cups heavy cream. Made this in less than 2 hours.

I really liked it. I made some changes otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. I mixed together all of the ingredients listed, except I used only 1 tablespoon pure vanilla, which was plenty. I was hesitant at the creaminess and sweetness of the ice cream, partially because I use homemade sweetened condensed milk (also on allrecipes). So I added 1 pint of heavy cream and 3/4 cup sugar. I whipped all the ingredients together in a bowl for about 2 minutes then poured into ice cream freezer. Make sure and ripen this ice cream before serving; otherwise it will start to melt in your bowl as you're eating it--an hour in the freezer does the trick.
Wonderful. Best ice cream ever. Very creamy. Will make this my go torrcipe.

This recipe was good to get me on the right track and turned out GREAT after I altered it. I mixed 2 cans of Eagle Brand, 1 qt of Heavy Whipping Cream, 1 qt of Half & Half, 2 Tbs of vanilla and after pouring into a 4 Qt ice cream mixer I filled to the line with whole milk! This was the absolute best ice cream EVER!! I have made it several times and it turns out AMAZING every time. There will be no left overs I PROMISE!! I am sure you could add fruit, chocolate, or any flavor or half this recipe and it would turn out just as good.
So easy, so good, so quick, so versatile.
We didn't care for this at all.

We just got a new Cuisinart Ice Cream Maker for Christmas and having never made home-made ice cream before I an trying out many recipes. This tasted good, but after I made it I froze it overnight. The resulting ice cream was very hard, and tasted more like diet ice cream. I think it needs more fat, maybe 2 cups half and half and 2 cups heavy cream. I also think that if it had been frozen for 3-4 hours, then eaten, the texture would have been much better. I might experiment with this recipe as others have. I would like it to work since it is so easy!
It was so so yummy and easy.
Easy & yummo.
I made this last night. its not bad but it frozen together and i can not dish out to well. but it has a good taste to it.

Like many of the others, I found this very easy to make! I have tried recipes that need to be cooked, etc. that taste gritty from the sugar. With sweetened milk, it doesn't happen. I made recipe as described and put in ice cream maker. Worked perfectly! As my family enjoyed it, we thought of many ways to add yummy things to it. This time we added 6-single serve instant coffee packs diluted in a very small amount of warm water to the mixture. (It did not dilute well in the milk mixture). It is in the freezing process now, but the mixture tastes divine! May add mini-chips for added texture…I'll see how I feel when the final mixing comes around!
Egg custard taste without eggs! Who'd a thunk it! This is a solid keeper.
I love this recipe! Easy and creamy! Will use it everytime we make hand cranked ice cream! !!!!!!!

Me and my girlfriend used the basic recipe but like others, changed the half and half to whole milk. Also, we gave it a mocha flavor by adding 1/4 cup of cocao powder along with 1 rounded tsp of instant coffee and 1 tsp of cinnamon. We used a Kitchen Aid ice cream freezer attachment and ran it for 25 minutes. Delicioso!
Yummy and very easy. Added 1 extra tablespoon of vanilla.

This is a great, simple vanilla ice cream recipe. A hit with my whole family. We were looking for something that had less of that "coating" effect you get with heavy cream recipes. This was creamy and delicious but not too much so. Easy to make and great right out of the ice cream maker.
Holy cow this was so easy and AWESOME!! If you've ever had Chic-Fil-A's Ice Dream (ice cream) this taste EXACTLY the same...maybe even better!

This recipe is wonderful! It is so easy to make and tastes great. I have used it several times at fund raisers for our high school band. Just pour everything in the ice cream freezer and plug it in. It's always a big hit!
Awesome! Now try 2 tablespoons of Maple extract and a handful or so of diced walnuts - Maple/Walnut Ice cream. Can include a teaspoon of vanilla extract.
This recipe is certainly quick and easy, and pretty good. However, if you are looking for a richer ice cream, this may not be for you. I will say, however, that the flavor rivaled Edy's vanilla bean!
It was a bit too sweet and heavy for me, but my kids loved.
Becomes really hard to scoop.

This was a revelation! Great taste and texture. I've made three batches so far, to rave reviews. Also, this works just as well with the no-fat condensed milk. I'm going to branch out to some new flavor combinations...look out, world!
I could not believe how easy it was!I have always avoided making ice cream, but now, what a pleasure. Will never buy ice cream again.
Easy easy easy. And very yummy!! A definitely a do over!!
wonderful and very easy

This was creamy and delicious. I followed the recipe and added a bit more vanilla, and used a machine! This was my first time making ice-cream and the reviews were good. I am glad I chose this recipe. I would highly recommend it to anyone making ice cream at home as it tastes just as good if not better than the store..good consistency as well!Bravo!

Yum! It really tastes like old fashioned home-made ice cream! My only hint for next time is that I will chill the mixture before I put it in my ice cream maker because it over-heated before it was completely frozen. It definitely could have been colder to start with, since the evaporated milk and vanilla were at room temp.
This was amazing!!!!!! LOVE IT
Really loved this. I did the refrigerator-freezer method. So creamy and rich.
Home run! Haven't made homemade ice cream in years. Found this recipe and it's so easy! Highly recommended.
So simple and delicious! I would change one thing, use maybe 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract instead of 2. It was really overpowering.
This was a last minute dessert. As I didn't have the full quantity of cream, I used half cream, half milk and substituted coffeee liquor for the vanilla. It was delicious.
It is very easy to make
Very good but cut vanilla
I liked the taste from the condensed milk but this was not my favorite vanilla ice cream recipe. I missed the richness that comes from recipes with whipping cream.
Easy fast delicious
The first time I made this it was good. The second time it tasted really funny...like it was way too much vanilla. Funny thing is I measured the second time, not the first.

I am making this ice cream right now in a Cuisinart ice cream/yogurt maker that someone gave to me. I would not call this ice cream but ice milk since it is not the custard based ice cream and basically all you are using is milk and sugar. I have to say, I am someone who craves sweets every day and this is way too sweet ! I would suggest somehow cutting amount of the sweetened condensed milk used in this recipe so that you use less, or maybe add other flavors to cut down on the sugar. It is so very sweet, I ate maybe 1/4th cup of the ice cream when it was done and I feel physically, like I just ate a whole bowl of sugar, with milk on it, jittery and nauseated. If I make this recipe again, I will just use 1/4th cup of sweetened condensed milk instead of the whole can and maybe add fruit for a sweet taste. 
As far as an ice cream taste, this tastes like ice milk. Also the costs is far greater making this than if you just buy a carton of Breyers on sale. Homemade is sometimes better in some recipes, but next time I will just buy Breyers or Edys.
This is so simple and O so good. A great hit with my family.

I only gave 4 stars because it tends to get a little icy and crumbly the longer it is in the freezer. That is the only thing holding this back from being 5 star. The first day is definitely the best. This is a good base recipe to add whatever you want. Play with extracts, too, if you want a different flavor altogether. Very easy, versatile, and tasty.
I did the refrigerator/freezer method and it tastes good but is extremely rich. I wouldn't have more then a scoop at a time with maybe some fruit or a cookie or piece of cake or pie with it.

I opted for this easy homemade recipe because I wanted foolproof results. This recipe was so quick and easy to make. It churned for 20 minutes, then I added chopped Butterfinger bars into the mixture for the last 10 minutes. It tastes fabulous. Put it in the freezer for a couple hours to let it harden. Makes a great summer dessert.

Yum! SImple and delicious. My first attempt at making ice cream with my Kitchen Aid attachment. It came out greatI followed some of the suggestions from comments and used 1.5 c heavy cream. Served it with fresh blueberries and raspberries. Next time, I'll try adding coconut extract, coconut, almonds and chocolate pieces for Almond Joy ice cream....Thanks Eagle Brand!!

Very nice. I only had half the amount of light cream called for, so I just halved the recipe. Instead of vanilla extract, I used the seeds/whatever you scrape from a vanilla bean instead. It had a lovely vanilla flavor that way. Husband was complaining it was gritty, but I think that is bc he was eating it before placing it back in the freezer--ice cream making is a process for a reason! Otherwise, he liked it. He added in M&Ms apparently bc he could. I tried it and thought it was good, but can't have much of it due to being lactose intolerant. Thanks for the recipe!

fast, easy, and delicious! didn't have half n half or light cream, so i substituted three cups of milk (2%) and 3/4 cup of real butter (softened). blended all ingredients in the blender for about 30 seconds.

I discovered one reason why this recipe might gets mixed reviews...I made the whipped cream version and it was amazing! Light, fluffy, froze perfectly and totally delicious. It was so good it prompted me to buy an ice cream maker. I have made it twice since, once with half and half the second time with cream. Both times it came out soft and developed lots of ice crystals when frozen. Next time I'm putting the gadgets away and sticking to the hand made version - wayyyyyy better!

This is a wonderful base ice cream. I've made it twice now, once adding almond extract, marzipan, and slivered almonds and once adding peanut butter. Both times it came out amazing! It's way easier than other ice cream recipes and comes out just as good.

Easiest homemade ice cream I've ever tried! This also turned out to be delicious with a marvelous light and creamy texture. I made vanilla but can't wait to try some other flavors. I made mine with my mixer and froze it in a covered container.
